intro: Desmazeria pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered desmazeria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It has simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Desmazeria pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and wetlands.
